7538  A = G1 / (G1 + componentConductance);
7539 
7540  // --- now, do we init our downstream??
7541  if (getPort2_CompAdaptor())
7542  getPort2_CompAdaptor()->initialize(getR2());
7543 
7544  // --- not used in this implementation but saving for extended use
7545  R3 = 1.0/ componentConductance;
7546  }
7547 
7549  virtual void setInput1(double _in1)
7550  {
7551  // --- save
7552  in1 = _in1;
7553 
7554  // --- read component
7555  N2 = 0.0;
7556  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7557  N2 = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getOutput();
7558 
7559  // --- form output
7560  out2 = N2 - A*(-in1 + N2);
7561 
7562  // --- deliver downstream
7563  if (getPort2_CompAdaptor())
7564  getPort2_CompAdaptor()->setInput1(out2);
7565  }
7566 
7568  virtual void setInput2(double _in2)
7569  {
7570  // --- save
7571  in2 = _in2;
7572 
7573  // --- calc N1
7574  N1 = in2 - A*(-in1 + N2);
7575 
7576  // --- calc out1
7577  out1 = -in1 + N2 + N1;
7578 
7579  // --- deliver upstream
7580  if (getPort1_CompAdaptor())
7581  getPort1_CompAdaptor()->setInput2(out1);
7582 
7583  // --- set component state
7584  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7585  getPort3_CompAdaptor()->setInput(N1);
7586  }
7587 
7589  virtual void setInput3(double _in3) { }
7590 
7592  virtual double getOutput1() { return out1; }
7593 
7595  virtual double getOutput2() { return out2; }
7596 
7598  virtual double getOutput3() { return out3; }
7599 
7600 private:
7601  double N1 = 0.0;
7602  double N2 = 0.0;
7603  double A = 0.0;
7604 };
7605 
7606 
7618 class WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor : public WdfAdaptorBase
7619 {
7620 public:
7621  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor() {}
7622  virtual ~WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor() {}
7623 
7625  virtual double getR2()
7626  {
7627  double componentConductance = 0.0;
7628  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7629  componentConductance = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getComponentConductance();
7630 
7631  // --- 1 / (sum of admittances)
7632  R2 = 1.0 / ((1.0 / R1) + componentConductance);
7633  return R2;
7634  }
7635 
7637  virtual void initialize(double _R1)
7638  {
7639  // --- save R1
7640  R1 = _R1;
7641 
7642  double G1 = 1.0 / R1;
7643  if (terminalResistance <= 0.0)
7644  terminalResistance = 1e-15;
7645 
7646  double G2 = 1.0 / terminalResistance;
7647  double componentConductance = 0.0;
7648  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7649  componentConductance = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getComponentConductance();
7650 
7651  A1 = 2.0*G1 / (G1 + componentConductance + G2);
7652  A3 = openTerminalResistance ? 0.0 : 2.0*G2 / (G1 + componentConductance + G2);
7653 
7654  // --- init downstream
7655  if (getPort2_CompAdaptor())
7656  getPort2_CompAdaptor()->initialize(getR2());
7657 
7658  // --- not used in this implementation but saving for extended use
7659  R3 = 1.0 / componentConductance;
7660  }
7661 
7663  virtual void setInput1(double _in1)
7664  {
7665  // --- save
7666  in1 = _in1;
7667 
7668  N2 = 0.0;
7669  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7670  N2 = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getOutput();
7671 
7672  // --- form N1
7673  N1 = -A1*(-in1 + N2) + N2 - A3*N2;
7674 
7675  // --- form output1
7676  out1 = -in1 + N2 + N1;
7677 
7678  // --- deliver upstream to input2
7679  if (getPort1_CompAdaptor())
7680  getPort1_CompAdaptor()->setInput2(out1);
7681 
7682  // --- calc out2 y(n)
7683  out2 = N2 + N1;
7684 
7685  // --- set component state
7686  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7687  getPort3_CompAdaptor()->setInput(N1);
7688  }
7689 
7691  virtual void setInput2(double _in2){ in2 = _in2;}
7692 
7694  virtual void setInput3(double _in3) { }
7695 
7697  virtual double getOutput1() { return out1; }
7698 
7700  virtual double getOutput2() { return out2; }
7701 
7703  virtual double getOutput3() { return out3; }
7704 
7705 private:
7706  double N1 = 0.0;
7707  double N2 = 0.0;
7708  double A1 = 0.0;
7709  double A3 = 0.0;
7710 };
7711 
7712 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ //
7713 // --- WDF Ladder Filter Design Examples --------------------------------------- //
7714 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ //
7715 //
7716 // --- 3rd order Butterworth LPF designed with Elsie www.TonneSoftware.comm
7717 //
7718 /*
7719  3rd Order Inductor-Leading LPF
7720 
7721  Rs = Rload = 600 ohms
7722 
7723  Series(L1) -> Parallel(C1) -> Series(L2)
7724 
7725  --L1-- | --L2--
7726  C1
7727  |
7728 
7729  fc = 1kHz
7730  L1 = 95.49e-3;
7731  C1 = 0.5305e-6;
7732  L2 = 95.49e-3;
7733 
7734  fc = 10kHz
7735  L1 = 9.549e-3;
7736  C1 = 0.05305e-6;
7737  L2 = 9.549e-3;
7738 */
7739 
7758 class WDFButterLPF3 : public IAudioSignalProcessor
7759 {
7760 public:
7761  WDFButterLPF3(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
7762  ~WDFButterLPF3(void) {} /* D-TOR */
7763 
7765  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
7766  {
7767  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
7768  seriesAdaptor_L1.reset(_sampleRate);
7769  parallelAdaptor_C1.reset(_sampleRate);
7770  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.reset(_sampleRate);
7771 
7772  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
7773  seriesAdaptor_L1.initializeAdaptorChain();
7774  return true;
7775  }
7776 
7778  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
7779 
7785  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
7786  {
7787  // --- push audio sample into series L1
7788  seriesAdaptor_L1.setInput1(xn);
7789 
7790  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
7791  return seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.getOutput2();
7792  }
7793 
7795  void createWDF()
7796  {
7797  // --- actual component values fc = 1kHz
7798  double L1_value = 95.49e-3; // 95.5 mH
7799  double C1_value = 0.5305e-6; // 0.53 uF
7800  double L2_value = 95.49e-3; // 95.5 mH
7801 
7802  // --- set adapter components
7803  seriesAdaptor_L1.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, L1_value);
7804  parallelAdaptor_C1.setComponent(wdfComponent::C, C1_value);
7805  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, L2_value);
7806 
7807  // --- connect adapters
7808  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L1, &parallelAdaptor_C1);
7809  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_C1, &seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2);
7810 
7811  // --- set source resistance
7812  seriesAdaptor_L1.setSourceResistance(600.0); // --- Rs = 600
7813 
7814  // --- set terminal resistance
7815  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setTerminalResistance(600.0); // --- Rload = 600
7816  }
7817 
7818 protected:
7819  // --- three adapters
7820  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L1;
7821  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_C1;
7822  WdfSeriesTerminatedAdaptor seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2;
7823 };
7824 
7844 class WDFTunableButterLPF3 : public IAudioSignalProcessor
7845 {
7846 public:
7847  WDFTunableButterLPF3(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
7848  ~WDFTunableButterLPF3(void) {} /* D-TOR */
7849 
7851  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
7852  {
7853  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
7854  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
7855  seriesAdaptor_L1.reset(_sampleRate);
7856  parallelAdaptor_C1.reset(_sampleRate);
7857  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.reset(_sampleRate);
7858 
7859  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
7860  seriesAdaptor_L1.initializeAdaptorChain();
7861  return true;
7862  }
7863 
7865  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
7866 
7872  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
7873  {
7874  // --- push audio sample into series L1
7875  seriesAdaptor_L1.setInput1(xn);
7876 
7877  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
7878  return seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.getOutput2();
7879  }
7880 
7882  void createWDF()
7883  {
7884  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc = 1Hz
7885  seriesAdaptor_L1.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, L1_norm);
7886  parallelAdaptor_C1.setComponent(wdfComponent::C, C1_norm);
7887  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, L2_norm);
7888 
7889  // --- connect adapters
7890  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L1, &parallelAdaptor_C1);
7891  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_C1, &seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2);
7892 
7893  // --- set source resistance
7894  seriesAdaptor_L1.setSourceResistance(600.0); // --- Rs = 600
7895 
7896  // --- set terminal resistance
7897  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setTerminalResistance(600.0); // --- Rload = 600
7898  }
7899 
7901  void setUsePostWarping(bool b) { useFrequencyWarping = b; }
7902 
7904  void setFilterFc(double fc_Hz)
7905  {
7906  if (useFrequencyWarping)
7907  {
7908  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
7909  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
7910  }
7911 
7912  seriesAdaptor_L1.setComponentValue(L1_norm / fc_Hz);
7913  parallelAdaptor_C1.setComponentValue(C1_norm / fc_Hz);
7914  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setComponentValue(L2_norm / fc_Hz);
7915  }
7916 
7917 protected:
7918  // --- three adapters
7919  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L1;
7920  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_C1;
7921  WdfSeriesTerminatedAdaptor seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2;
7922 
7923  double L1_norm = 95.493; // 95.5 mH
7924  double C1_norm = 530.516e-6; // 0.53 uF
7925  double L2_norm = 95.493; // 95.5 mH
7926 
7927  bool useFrequencyWarping = false;
7928  double sampleRate = 1.0;
7929 };
7930 
7949 class WDFBesselBSF3 : public IAudioSignalProcessor
7950 {
7951 public:
7952  WDFBesselBSF3(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
7953  ~WDFBesselBSF3(void) {} /* D-TOR */
7954 
7956  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
7957  {
7958  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
7959  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.reset(_sampleRate);
7960  parallelAdaptor_L2C2.reset(_sampleRate);
7961  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3.reset(_sampleRate);
7962 
7963  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
7964  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.initializeAdaptorChain();
7965 
7966  return true;
7967  }
7968 
7970  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
7971 
7977  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
7978  {
7979  // --- push audio sample into series L1
7980  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setInput1(xn);
7981 
7982  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
7983  return seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3.getOutput2();
7984  }
7985 
7987  void createWDF()
7988  {
7989  // --- set component values
7990  // --- fo = 5kHz
7991  // BW = 2kHz or Q = 2.5
7992  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 16.8327e-3, 0.060193e-6); /* L, C */
7993  parallelAdaptor_L2C2.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 49.1978e-3, 0.02059e-6); /* L, C */
7994  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 2.57755e-3, 0.393092e-6); /* L, C */
7995 
7996  // --- connect adapters
7997  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L1C1, &parallelAdaptor_L2C2);
7998  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_L2C2, &seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3);
7999 
8000  // --- set source resistance
8001  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setSourceResistance(600.0); // Ro = 600
8002 
8003  // --- set terminal resistance
8004  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3.setTerminalResistance(600.0);
8005  }
8006 
8007 protected:
8008  // --- three adapters
8009  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L1C1;
8010  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_L2C2;
8011  WdfSeriesTerminatedAdaptor seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3;
8012 };
8013 
8014 
8033 class WDFConstKBPF6 : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8034 {
8035 public:
8036  WDFConstKBPF6(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8037  ~WDFConstKBPF6(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8038 
8040  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8041  {
8042  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8043  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.reset(_sampleRate);
8044  parallelAdaptor_L2C2.reset(_sampleRate);
8045 
8046  seriesAdaptor_L3C3.reset(_sampleRate);
8047  parallelAdaptor_L4C4.reset(_sampleRate);
8048 
8049  seriesAdaptor_L5C5.reset(_sampleRate);
8050  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6.reset(_sampleRate);
8051 
8052  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8053  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.initializeAdaptorChain();
8054  return true;
8055  }
8056 
8058  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8059 
8065  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8066  {
8067  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8068  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setInput1(xn);
8069 
8070  // --- output is at terminated L6C6 output2
8071  double output = parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6.getOutput2();
8072 
8073  return output;
8074  }
8075 
8077  void createWDF()
8078  {
8079  // --- fo = 5kHz
8080  // BW = 2kHz or Q = 2.5
8081  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 47.7465e-3, 0.02122e-6);
8082  parallelAdaptor_L2C2.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 3.81972e-3, 0.265258e-6);
8083 
8084  seriesAdaptor_L3C3.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 95.493e-3, 0.01061e-6);
8085  parallelAdaptor_L4C4.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 3.81972e-3, 0.265258e-6);
8086 
8087  seriesAdaptor_L5C5.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 95.493e-3, 0.01061e-6);
8088  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 7.63944e-3, 0.132629e-6);
8089 
8090  // --- connect adapters
8091  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L1C1, &parallelAdaptor_L2C2);
8092  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_L2C2, &seriesAdaptor_L3C3);
8093  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L3C3, &parallelAdaptor_L4C4);
8094  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_L4C4, &seriesAdaptor_L5C5);
8095  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L5C5, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6);
8096 
8097  // --- set source resistance
8098  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setSourceResistance(600.0); // Ro = 600
8099 
8100  // --- set terminal resistance
8101  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6.setTerminalResistance(600.0);
8102  }
8103 
8104 protected:
8105  // --- six adapters
8106  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L1C1;
8107  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_L2C2;
8108 
8109  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L3C3;
8110  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_L4C4;
8111 
8112  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L5C5;
8113  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6;
8114 };
8115 
8116 
8128 struct WDFParameters
8129 {
8130  WDFParameters() {}
8132  WDFParameters& operator=(const WDFParameters& params)
8133  {
8134  if (this == &params)
8135  return *this;
8136 
8137  fc = params.fc;
8138  Q = params.Q;
8139  boostCut_dB = params.boostCut_dB;
8140  frequencyWarping = params.frequencyWarping;
8141  return *this;
8142  }
8143 
8144  // --- individual parameters
8145  double fc = 100.0;
8146  double Q = 0.707;
8147  double boostCut_dB = 0.0;
8148  bool frequencyWarping = true;
8149 };
8150 
8168 class WDFIdealRLCLPF : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8169 {
8170 public:
8171  WDFIdealRLCLPF(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8172  ~WDFIdealRLCLPF(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8173 
8175  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8176  {
8177  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
8178 
8179  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8180  seriesAdaptor_RL.reset(_sampleRate);
8181  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C.reset(_sampleRate);
8182 
8183  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8184  seriesAdaptor_RL.initializeAdaptorChain();
8185  return true;
8186  }
8187 
8189  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8190 
8196  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8197  {
8198  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8199  seriesAdaptor_RL.setInput1(xn);
8200 
8201  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
8202  // note compensation scaling by -6dB = 0.5
8203  // because of WDF assumption about Rs and Rload
8204  return 0.5*parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C.getOutput2();
8205  }
8206 
8208  void createWDF()
8209  {
8210  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc =
8211  // initial values for fc = 1kHz Q = 0.707
8212  // Holding C Constant at 1e-6
8213  // L = 2.533e-2
8214  // R = 2.251131 e2
8215  seriesAdaptor_RL.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesRL, 2.251131e2, 2.533e-2);
8216  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C.setComponent(wdfComponent::C, 1.0e-6);
8217 
8218  // --- connect adapters
8219  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_RL, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C);
8220 
8221  // --- set source resistance
8222  seriesAdaptor_RL.setSourceResistance(0.0); // --- Rs = 600
8223 
8224  // --- set open ckt termination
8225  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C.setOpenTerminalResistance(true);
8226  }
8227 
8232  WDFParameters getParameters() { return wdfParameters; }
8233 
8238  void setParameters(const WDFParameters& _wdfParameters)
8239  {
8240  if (_wdfParameters.fc != wdfParameters.fc ||
8241  _wdfParameters.Q != wdfParameters.Q ||
8242  _wdfParameters.boostCut_dB != wdfParameters.boostCut_dB ||
8243  _wdfParameters.frequencyWarping != wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8244  {
8245  wdfParameters = _wdfParameters;
8246  double fc_Hz = wdfParameters.fc;
8247 
8248  if (wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8249  {
8250  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
8251  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
8252  }
8253 
8254  double inductorValue = 1.0 / (1.0e-6 * pow((2.0*kPi*fc_Hz), 2.0));
8255  double resistorValue = (1.0 / wdfParameters.Q)*(pow(inductorValue / 1.0e-6, 0.5));
8256 
8257  seriesAdaptor_RL.setComponentValue_RL(resistorValue, inductorValue);
8258  }
8259  }
8260 
8261 protected:
8262  WDFParameters wdfParameters;
8263 
8264  // --- adapters
8265  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_RL;
8266  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C;
8267 
8268  double sampleRate = 1.0;
8269 
8270 };
8271 
8289 class WDFIdealRLCHPF : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8290 {
8291 public:
8292  WDFIdealRLCHPF(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8293  ~WDFIdealRLCHPF(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8294 
8296  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8297  {
8298  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
8299  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8300  seriesAdaptor_RC.reset(_sampleRate);
8301  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.reset(_sampleRate);
8302 
8303  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8304  seriesAdaptor_RC.initializeAdaptorChain();
8305  return true;
8306  }
8307 
8309  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8310 
8316  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8317  {
8318  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8319  seriesAdaptor_RC.setInput1(xn);
8320 
8321  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
8322  // note compensation scaling by -6dB = 0.5
8323  // because of WDF assumption about Rs and Rload
8324  return 0.5*parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.getOutput2();
8325  }
8326 
8328  void createWDF()
8329  {
8330  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc =
8331  // initial values for fc = 1kHz Q = 0.707
8332  // Holding C Constant at 1e-6
8333  // L = 2.533e-2
8334  // R = 2.251131 e2
8335  seriesAdaptor_RC.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesRC, 2.251131e2, 1.0e-6);
8336  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, 2.533e-2);
8337 
8338  // --- connect adapters
8339  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_RC, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L);
8340 
8341  // --- set source resistance
8342  seriesAdaptor_RC.setSourceResistance(0.0); // --- Rs = 600
8343 
8344  // --- set open ckt termination
8345  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.setOpenTerminalResistance(true);
8346  }
8347 
8352  WDFParameters getParameters() { return wdfParameters; }
8353 
8358  void setParameters(const WDFParameters& _wdfParameters)
8359  {
8360  if (_wdfParameters.fc != wdfParameters.fc ||
8361  _wdfParameters.Q != wdfParameters.Q ||
8362  _wdfParameters.boostCut_dB != wdfParameters.boostCut_dB ||
8363  _wdfParameters.frequencyWarping != wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8364  {
8365  wdfParameters = _wdfParameters;
8366  double fc_Hz = wdfParameters.fc;
8367 
8368  if (wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8369  {
8370  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
8371  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
8372  }
8373 
8374  double inductorValue = 1.0 / (1.0e-6 * pow((2.0*kPi*fc_Hz), 2.0));
8375  double resistorValue = (1.0 / wdfParameters.Q)*(pow(inductorValue / 1.0e-6, 0.5));
8376 
8377  seriesAdaptor_RC.setComponentValue_RC(resistorValue, 1.0e-6);
8378  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.setComponentValue(inductorValue);
8379  }
8380  }
8381 
8382 
8383 protected:
8384  WDFParameters wdfParameters;
8385 
8386  // --- three
8387  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_RC;
8388  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L;
8389 
8390  double sampleRate = 1.0;
8391 };
8392 
8410 class WDFIdealRLCBPF : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8411 {
8412 public:
8413  WDFIdealRLCBPF(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8414  ~WDFIdealRLCBPF(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8415 
8417  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8418  {
8419  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
8420  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8421  seriesAdaptor_LC.reset(_sampleRate);
8422  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.reset(_sampleRate);
8423 
8424  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8425  seriesAdaptor_LC.initializeAdaptorChain();
8426  return true;
8427  }
8428 
8430  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8431 
8437  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8438  {
8439  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8440  seriesAdaptor_LC.setInput1(xn);
8441 
8442  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
8443  // note compensation scaling by -6dB = 0.5
8444  // because of WDF assumption about Rs and Rload
8445  return 0.5*parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.getOutput2();
8446  }
8447 
8449  void createWDF()
8450  {
8451  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc =
8452  // initial values for fc = 1kHz Q = 0.707
8453  // Holding C Constant at 1e-6
8454  // L = 2.533e-2
8455  // R = 2.251131 e2
8456  seriesAdaptor_LC.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 2.533e-2, 1.0e-6);
8457  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.setComponent(wdfComponent::R, 2.251131e2);
8458 
8459  // --- connect adapters
8460  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_LC, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R);
8461 
8462  // --- set source resistance
8463  seriesAdaptor_LC.setSourceResistance(0.0); // --- Rs = 600
8464 
8465  // --- set open ckt termination
8466  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.setOpenTerminalResistance(true);
8467  }
8468 
8473  WDFParameters getParameters() { return wdfParameters; }
8474 
8479  void setParameters(const WDFParameters& _wdfParameters)
8480  {
8481  if (_wdfParameters.fc != wdfParameters.fc ||
8482  _wdfParameters.Q != wdfParameters.Q ||
8483  _wdfParameters.boostCut_dB != wdfParameters.boostCut_dB ||
8484  _wdfParameters.frequencyWarping != wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8485  {
8486  wdfParameters = _wdfParameters;
8487  double fc_Hz = wdfParameters.fc;
8488 
8489  if (wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8490  {
8491  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
8492  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
8493  }
8494 
8495  double inductorValue = 1.0 / (1.0e-6 * pow((2.0*kPi*fc_Hz), 2.0));
8496  double resistorValue = (1.0 / wdfParameters.Q)*(pow(inductorValue / 1.0e-6, 0.5));
8497 
8498  seriesAdaptor_LC.setComponentValue_LC(inductorValue, 1.0e-6);
8499  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.setComponentValue(resistorValue);
8500  }
8501  }
8502 
8503 protected:
8504  WDFParameters wdfParameters;
8505 
8506  // --- adapters
8507  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_LC;
8508  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R;
8509 
8510  double sampleRate = 1.0;
8511 };
8512 
8513 
8531 class WDFIdealRLCBSF : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8532 {
8533 public:
8534  WDFIdealRLCBSF(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8535  ~WDFIdealRLCBSF(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8536 
8538  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8539  {
8540  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
8541  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8542  seriesAdaptor_R.reset(_sampleRate);
8543  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.reset(_sampleRate);
8544 
8545  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8546  seriesAdaptor_R.initializeAdaptorChain();
8547  return true;
8548  }
8549 
8551  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8552 
8558  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8559  {
8560  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8561  seriesAdaptor_R.setInput1(xn);
8562 
8563  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
8564  // note compensation scaling by -6dB = 0.5
8565  // because of WDF assumption about Rs and Rload
8566  return 0.5*parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.getOutput2();
8567  }
8568 
8570  void createWDF()
8571  {
8572  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc =
8573  // initial values for fc = 1kHz Q = 0.707
8574  // Holding C Constant at 1e-6
8575  // L = 2.533e-2
8576  // R = 2.251131 e2
8577  seriesAdaptor_R.setComponent(wdfComponent::R, 2.533e-2);
8578  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 2.533e-2, 1.0e-6);
8579 
8580  // --- connect adapters
8581  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_R, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC);
8582 
8583  // --- set source resistance
8584  seriesAdaptor_R.setSourceResistance(0.0); // --- Rs = 600
8585 
8586  // --- set open ckt termination
8587  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.setOpenTerminalResistance(true);
8588  }
8589 
8594  WDFParameters getParameters() { return wdfParameters; }
8595 
8600  void setParameters(const WDFParameters& _wdfParameters)
8601  {
8602  if (_wdfParameters.fc != wdfParameters.fc ||
8603  _wdfParameters.Q != wdfParameters.Q ||
8604  _wdfParameters.boostCut_dB != wdfParameters.boostCut_dB ||
8605  _wdfParameters.frequencyWarping != wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8606  {
8607  wdfParameters = _wdfParameters;
8608  double fc_Hz = wdfParameters.fc;
8609 
8610  if (wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8611  {
8612  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
8613  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
8614  }
8615 
8616  double inductorValue = 1.0 / (1.0e-6 * pow((2.0*kPi*fc_Hz), 2.0));
8617  double resistorValue = (1.0 / wdfParameters.Q)*(pow(inductorValue / 1.0e-6, 0.5));
8618 
8619  seriesAdaptor_R.setComponentValue(resistorValue);
8620  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.setComponentValue_LC(inductorValue, 1.0e-6);
8621  }
8622  }
8623 
8624 protected:
8625  WDFParameters wdfParameters;
8626 
8627  // --- adapters
8628  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_R;
8629  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC;
8630 
8631  double sampleRate = 1.0;
8632 };
8633 
8634 
8635 // ------------------------------------------------------------------ //
8636 // --- OBJECTS REQUIRING FFTW --------------------------------------- //
8637 // ------------------------------------------------------------------ //
8638 
8652 enum class windowType {kNoWindow, kRectWindow, kHannWindow, kBlackmanHarrisWindow, kHammingWindow };
8653 
8664 inline std::unique_ptr<double[]> makeWindow(unsigned int windowLength, unsigned int hopSize, windowType window, double& gainCorrectionValue)
8665 {
8666  std::unique_ptr<double[]> windowBuffer;
8667  windowBuffer.reset(new double[windowLength]);
8668 
8669  if (!windowBuffer) return nullptr;
8670 
8671  double overlap = hopSize > 0.0 ? 1.0 - (double)hopSize / (double)windowLength : 0.0;
8672  gainCorrectionValue = 0.0;
8673 
8674  for (int n = 0; n < windowLength; n++)
8675  {
8676  if (window == windowType::kRectWindow)
8677  {
8678  if (n >= 1 && n <= windowLength - 1)
8679  windowBuffer[n] = 1.0;
8680  }
8681  else if (window == windowType::kHammingWindow)
8682  {
8683  windowBuffer[n] = 0.54 - 0.46*cos((n*2.0*kPi) / (windowLength));
8684  }
8685  else if (window == windowType::kHannWindow)
8686  {
8687  windowBuffer[n] = 0.5 * (1 - cos((n*2.0*kPi) / (windowLength)));
8688  }
8689  else if (window == windowType::kBlackmanHarrisWindow)
8690  {
8691  windowBuffer[n] = (0.42323 - (0.49755*cos((n*2.0*kPi) / (windowLength))) + 0.07922*cos((2 * n*2.0*kPi) / (windowLength)));
8692  }
8693  else if (window == windowType::kNoWindow)
8694  {
8695  windowBuffer[n] = 1.0;
8696  }
8697 
8698  gainCorrectionValue += windowBuffer[n];
8699  }
8700 
8701  // --- calculate gain correction factor
8702  if (window != windowType::kNoWindow)
8703  gainCorrectionValue = (1.0 - overlap) / gainCorrectionValue;
8704  else
8705  gainCorrectionValue = 1.0 / gainCorrectionValue;
8706 
8707  return windowBuffer;
8708 }
8709 
8710 #define HAVE_FFTW 1
8711 // --- FFTW ---
8712 #ifdef HAVE_FFTW
8713 #include "fftw3.h"
8714 
8732 class FastFFT
8733 {
8734 public:
8735  FastFFT() {} /* C-TOR */
8736  ~FastFFT() {
8737  if (windowBuffer) delete[] windowBuffer;
8738  destroyFFTW();
8739  } /* D-TOR */
8740 
8742  void initialize(unsigned int _frameLength, windowType _window);
8743 
8745  void destroyFFTW();
8746 
8748  fftw_complex* doFFT(double* inputReal, double* inputImag = nullptr);
8749 
8751  fftw_complex* doInverseFFT(double* inputReal, double* inputImag);
8752 
8754  unsigned int getFrameLength() { return frameLength; }
8755 
8756 protected:
8757  // --- setup FFTW
8758  fftw_complex* fft_input = nullptr;
8759  fftw_complex* fft_result = nullptr;
8760  fftw_complex* ifft_input = nullptr;
8761  fftw_complex* ifft_result = nullptr;
8762  fftw_plan plan_forward = nullptr;
8763  fftw_plan plan_backward = nullptr;
8764 
8765  double* windowBuffer = nullptr;
8766  double windowGainCorrection = 1.0;
8767  windowType window = windowType::kHannWindow;
8768  unsigned int frameLength = 0;
8769 };
8770 
8771 
8791 class PhaseVocoder
8792 {
8793 public:
8794  PhaseVocoder() {} /* C-TOR */
8795  ~PhaseVocoder() {
8796  if (inputBuffer) delete[] inputBuffer;
8797  if (outputBuffer) delete[] outputBuffer;
8798  if (windowBuffer) delete[] windowBuffer;
8799  destroyFFTW();
8800  } /* D-TOR */
8801 
8803  void initialize(unsigned int _frameLength, unsigned int _hopSize, windowType _window);
8804 
8806  void destroyFFTW();
8807 
8809  double processAudioSample(double input, bool& fftReady);
8810 
8812  bool addZeroPad(unsigned int count);
8813 
8815  bool advanceAndCheckFFT();
8816 
8818  fftw_complex* getFFTData() { return fft_result; }
8819 
8821  fftw_complex* getIFFTData() { return ifft_result; }
8822 
8824  void doInverseFFT();
8825 
8827  void doOverlapAdd(double* outputData = nullptr, int length = 0);
8828 
8830  unsigned int getFrameLength() { return frameLength; }
8831 
8833  unsigned int getHopSize() { return hopSize; }
8834 
8836  double getOverlap() { return overlap; }
8837 
8839  // --- for fast convolution and other overlap-add algorithms
8840  // that are not hop-size dependent
8841  void setOverlapAddOnly(bool b){ bool overlapAddOnly = b; }
8842 
8843 protected:
8844  // --- setup FFTW
8845  fftw_complex* fft_input = nullptr;
8846  fftw_complex* fft_result = nullptr;
8847  fftw_complex* ifft_result = nullptr;
8848  fftw_plan plan_forward = nullptr;
8849  fftw_plan plan_backward = nullptr;
8850 
8851  // --- linear buffer for window
8852  double* windowBuffer = nullptr;
8853 
8854  // --- circular buffers for input and output
8855  double* inputBuffer = nullptr;
8856  double* outputBuffer = nullptr;
8857 
8858  // --- index and wrap masks for input and output buffers
8859  unsigned int inputWriteIndex = 0;
8860  unsigned int outputWriteIndex = 0;
8861  unsigned int inputReadIndex = 0;
8862  unsigned int outputReadIndex = 0;
8863  unsigned int wrapMask = 0;
8864  unsigned int wrapMaskOut = 0;
8865 
8866  // --- amplitude correction factor, aking into account both hopsize (overlap)
8867  // and the window power itself
8868  double windowHopCorrection = 1.0;
8869 
8870  // --- these allow a more robust combination of user interaction
8871  bool needInverseFFT = false;
8872  bool needOverlapAdd = false;
8873 
8874  // --- our window type; you can add more windows if you like
8875  windowType window = windowType::kHannWindow;
8876 
8877  // --- counters
8878  unsigned int frameLength = 0;
8879  unsigned int fftCounter = 0;
8880 
8881  // --- hop-size and overlap (mathematically related)
8882  unsigned int hopSize = 0;
8883  double overlap = 1.0;
8884 
8885  // --- flag for overlap-add algorithms that do not involve hop-size, other
8886  // than setting the overlap
8887  bool overlapAddOnly = false;
8888 
8889 };
8890 
8910 class FastConvolver
8911 {
8912 public:
8913  FastConvolver() {
8914  vocoder.setOverlapAddOnly(true);
8915  } /* C-TOR */
8916  ~FastConvolver() {
8917  if (filterIR)
8918  delete[] filterIR;
8919 
8920  if (filterFFT)
8921  fftw_free(filterFFT);
8922  } /* D-TOR */
8923 
8928  void initialize(unsigned int _filterImpulseLength)
8929  {
8930  if (filterImpulseLength == _filterImpulseLength)
8931  return;
8932 
8933  // --- setup a specialized vocoder with 50% hop size
8934  filterImpulseLength = _filterImpulseLength;
8935  vocoder.initialize(filterImpulseLength * 2, filterImpulseLength, windowType::kNoWindow);
8936 
8937  // --- initialize the FFT object for capturing the filter FFT
8938  filterFastFFT.initialize(filterImpulseLength * 2, windowType::kNoWindow);
8939 
8940  // --- array to hold the filter IR; this could be localized to the particular function that uses it
8941  if (filterIR)
8942  delete [] filterIR;
8943  filterIR = new double[filterImpulseLength * 2];
8944  memset(&filterIR[0], 0, filterImpulseLength * 2 * sizeof(double));
8945 
8946  // --- allocate the filter FFT arrays
8947  if(filterFFT)
8948  fftw_free(filterFFT);
8949 
8950  filterFFT = (fftw_complex*)fftw_malloc(sizeof(fftw_complex) * filterImpulseLength * 2);
8951 
8952  // --- reset
8953  inputCount = 0;
8954  }
8955 
8957  void setFilterIR(double* irBuffer)
8958  {
8959  if (!irBuffer) return;
8960 
8961  memset(&filterIR[0], 0, filterImpulseLength * 2 * sizeof(double));
8962 
8963  // --- copy over first half; filterIR len = filterImpulseLength * 2
8964  int m = 0;
8965  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < filterImpulseLength; i++)
8966  {
8967  filterIR[i] = irBuffer[i];
8968  }
8969 
8970  // --- take FFT of the h(n)
8971  fftw_complex* fftOfFilter = filterFastFFT.doFFT(&filterIR[0]);
8972 
8973  // --- copy the FFT into our local buffer for storage; also
8974  // we never want to hold a pointer to a FFT output
8975  // for more than one local function's worth
8976  // could replace with memcpy( )
8977  for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++)
8978  {
8979  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < filterImpulseLength * 2; j++)
8980  {
8981  filterFFT[j][i] = fftOfFilter[j][i];
8982  }
8983  }
8984  }
8985 
8987  double processAudioSample(double input)
8988  {
8989  bool fftReady = false;
8990  double output = 0.0;
8991 
8992  if (inputCount == filterImpulseLength)
8993  {
8994  fftReady = vocoder.addZeroPad(filterImpulseLength);
8995 
8996  if (fftReady) // should happen on time
8997  {
8998  // --- multiply our filter IR with the vocoder FFT
8999  fftw_complex* signalFFT = vocoder.getFFTData();
9000  if (signalFFT)
9001  {
9002  unsigned int fff = vocoder.getFrameLength();
9003 
9004  // --- complex multiply with FFT of IR
9005  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < filterImpulseLength * 2; i++)
9006  {
9007  // --- get real/imag parts of each FFT
9008  ComplexNumber signal(signalFFT[i][0], signalFFT[i][1]);
9009  ComplexNumber filter(filterFFT[i][0], filterFFT[i][1]);
9010 
9011  // --- use complex multiply function; this convolves in the time domain
9012  ComplexNumber product = complexMultiply(signal, filter);
9013 
9014  // --- overwrite the FFT bins
9015  signalFFT[i][0] = product.real;
9016  signalFFT[i][1] = product.imag;
9017  }
9018  }
9019  }
9020 
9021  // --- reset counter
9022  inputCount = 0;
9023  }
9024 
9025  // --- process next sample
9026  output = vocoder.processAudioSample(input, fftReady);
9027  inputCount++;
9028 
9029  return output;
9030  }
9031 
9033  unsigned int getFrameLength() { return vocoder.getFrameLength(); }
9034 
9036  unsigned int getFilterIRLength() { return filterImpulseLength; }
9037 
9038 protected:
9039  PhaseVocoder vocoder;
9040  FastFFT filterFastFFT;
9041  fftw_complex* filterFFT = nullptr;
9042  double* filterIR = nullptr;
9043  unsigned int inputCount = 0;
9044  unsigned int filterImpulseLength = 0;
9045 };
9046 
9047 // --- PSM Vocoder
9048 const unsigned int PSM_FFT_LEN = 4096;
9049 
9063 struct BinData
9064 {
9065  BinData() {}
9067  BinData& operator=(const BinData& params) // need this override for collections to work
9068  {
9069  if (this == &params)
9070  return *this;
9071 
9072  isPeak = params.isPeak;
9073  magnitude = params.magnitude;
9074  phi = params.phi;
9075 
9076  psi = params.psi;
9077  localPeakBin = params.localPeakBin;
9078  previousPeakBin = params.previousPeakBin;
9079  updatedPhase = params.updatedPhase;
9080 
9081  return *this;
9082  }
9083 
9085  void reset()
9086  {
9087  isPeak = false;
9088  magnitude = 0.0;
9089  phi = 0.0;
9090 
9091  psi = 0.0;
9092  localPeakBin = 0;
9093  previousPeakBin = -1; // -1 is flag
9094  updatedPhase = 0.0;
9095  }
9096 
9097  bool isPeak = false;
9098  double magnitude = 0.0;
9099  double phi = 0.0;
9100  double psi = 0.0;
9101  unsigned int localPeakBin = 0;
9102  int previousPeakBin = -1;
9103  double updatedPhase = 0.0;
9104 };
9105 
9117 struct PSMVocoderParameters
9118 {
9119  PSMVocoderParameters() {}
9121  PSMVocoderParameters& operator=(const PSMVocoderParameters& params) // need this override for collections to work
9122  {
9123  if (this == &params)
9124  return *this;
9125 
9126  pitchShiftSemitones = params.pitchShiftSemitones;
9127  enablePeakPhaseLocking = params.enablePeakPhaseLocking;
9128  enablePeakTracking = params.enablePeakTracking;
9129 
9130  return *this;
9131  }
9132 
9133  // --- params
9134  double pitchShiftSemitones = 0.0;
9135  bool enablePeakPhaseLocking = false;
9136  bool enablePeakTracking = false;
9137 };
9138 
9157 class PSMVocoder : public IAudioSignalProcessor
9158 {
9159 public:
9160  PSMVocoder() {
9161  vocoder.initialize(PSM_FFT_LEN, PSM_FFT_LEN/4, windowType::kHannWindow); // 75% overlap
9162  } /* C-TOR */
9163  ~PSMVocoder() {
9164  if (windowBuff) delete[] windowBuff;
9165  if (outputBuff) delete[] outputBuff;
9166 
9167  } /* D-TOR */
9168 
9170  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
9171  {
9172  memset(&phi[0], 0, sizeof(double)*PSM_FFT_LEN);
9173  memset(&psi[0], 0, sizeof(double)* PSM_FFT_LEN);
9174  if(outputBuff)
9175  memset(outputBuff, 0, sizeof(double)*outputBufferLength);
9176 
9177  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9178  {
9179  binData[i].reset();
9180  binDataPrevious[i].reset();
9181 
9182  peakBins[i] = -1;
9183  peakBinsPrevious[i] = -1;
9184  }
9185 
9186  return true;
9187  }
9188 
9190  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
9191 
9193  void setPitchShift(double semitones)
9194  {
9195  // --- this is costly so only update when things changed
9196  double newAlpha = pow(2.0, semitones / 12.0);
9197  double newOutputBufferLength = round((1.0/newAlpha)*(double)PSM_FFT_LEN);
9198 
9199  // --- check for change
9200  if (newOutputBufferLength == outputBufferLength)
9201  return;
9202 
9203  // --- new stuff
9204  alphaStretchRatio = newAlpha;
9205  ha = hs / alphaStretchRatio;
9206 
9207  // --- set output resample buffer
9208  outputBufferLength = newOutputBufferLength;
9209 
9210  // --- create Hann window
9211  if (windowBuff) delete[] windowBuff;
9212  windowBuff = new double[outputBufferLength];
9213  windowCorrection = 0.0;
9214  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < outputBufferLength; i++)
9215  {
9216  windowBuff[i] = 0.5 * (1.0 - cos((i*2.0*kPi) / (outputBufferLength)));
9217  windowCorrection += windowBuff[i];
9218  }
9219  windowCorrection = 1.0 / windowCorrection;
9220 
9221  // --- create output buffer
9222  if (outputBuff) delete[] outputBuff;
9223  outputBuff = new double[outputBufferLength];
9224  memset(outputBuff, 0, sizeof(double)*outputBufferLength);
9225  }
9226 
9228  int findPreviousNearestPeak(int peakIndex)
9229  {
9230  if (peakBinsPrevious[0] == -1) // first run, there is no peak
9231  return -1;
9232 
9233  int delta = -1;
9234  int previousPeak = -1;
9235  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9236  {
9237  if (peakBinsPrevious[i] < 0)
9238  break;
9239 
9240  int dist = abs(peakIndex - peakBinsPrevious[i]);
9241  if (dist > PSM_FFT_LEN/4)
9242  break;
9243 
9244  if (i == 0)
9245  {
9246  previousPeak = i;
9247  delta = dist;
9248  }
9249  else if (dist < delta)
9250  {
9251  previousPeak = i;
9252  delta = dist;
9253  }
9254  }
9255 
9256  return previousPeak;
9257  }
9258 
9260  void findPeaksAndRegionsOfInfluence()
9261  {
9262  // --- FIND PEAKS --- //
9263  //
9264  // --- find local maxima in 4-sample window
9265  double localWindow[4] = { 0.0 };
9266  int m = 0;
9267  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9268  {
9269  if (i == 0)
9270  {
9271  localWindow[0] = 0.0;
9272  localWindow[1] = 0.0;
9273  localWindow[2] = binData[i + 1].magnitude;
9274  localWindow[3] = binData[i + 2].magnitude;
9275  }
9276  else if (i == 1)
9277  {
9278  localWindow[0] = 0.0;
9279  localWindow[1] = binData[i - 1].magnitude;
9280  localWindow[2] = binData[i + 1].magnitude;
9281  localWindow[3] = binData[i + 2].magnitude;
9282  }
9283  else if (i == PSM_FFT_LEN - 1)
9284  {
9285  localWindow[0] = binData[i - 2].magnitude;
9286  localWindow[1] = binData[i - 1].magnitude;
9287  localWindow[2] = 0.0;
9288  localWindow[3] = 0.0;
9289  }
9290  else if (i == PSM_FFT_LEN - 2)
9291  {
9292  localWindow[0] = binData[i - 2].magnitude;
9293  localWindow[1] = binData[i - 1].magnitude;
9294  localWindow[2] = binData[i + 1].magnitude;
9295  localWindow[3] = 0.0;
9296  }
9297  else
9298  {
9299  localWindow[0] = binData[i - 2].magnitude;
9300  localWindow[1] = binData[i - 1].magnitude;
9301  localWindow[2] = binData[i + 1].magnitude;
9302  localWindow[3] = binData[i + 2].magnitude;
9303  }
9304 
9305  // --- found peak bin!
9306  if (binData[i].magnitude > 0.00001 &&
9307  binData[i].magnitude > localWindow[0]
9308  && binData[i].magnitude > localWindow[1]
9309  && binData[i].magnitude > localWindow[2]
9310  && binData[i].magnitude > localWindow[3])
9311  {
9312  binData[i].isPeak = true;
9313  peakBins[m++] = i;
9314 
9315  // --- for peak bins, assume that it is part of a previous, moving peak
9316  if (parameters.enablePeakTracking)
9317  binData[i].previousPeakBin = findPreviousNearestPeak(i);
9318  else
9319  binData[i].previousPeakBin = -1;
9320  }
9321  }
9322 
9323  // --- assign peak bosses
9324  if (m > 0)
9325  {
9326  int n = 0;
9327  int bossPeakBin = peakBins[n];
9328  double nextPeak = peakBins[++n];
9329  int midBoundary = (nextPeak - (double)bossPeakBin) / 2.0 + bossPeakBin;
9330 
9331  if (nextPeak >= 0)
9332  {
9333  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9334  {
9335  if (i <= bossPeakBin)
9336  {
9337  binData[i].localPeakBin = bossPeakBin;
9338  }
9339  else if (i < midBoundary)
9340  {
9341  binData[i].localPeakBin = bossPeakBin;
9342  }
9343  else // > boundary, calc next set
9344  {
9345  bossPeakBin = nextPeak;
9346  nextPeak = peakBins[++n];
9347  if (nextPeak > bossPeakBin)
9348  midBoundary = (nextPeak - (double)bossPeakBin) / 2.0 + bossPeakBin;
9349  else // nextPeak == -1
9350  midBoundary = PSM_FFT_LEN;
9351 
9352  binData[i].localPeakBin = bossPeakBin;
9353  }
9354  }
9355  }
9356  }
9357  }
9358 
9364  virtual double processAudioSample(double input)
9365  {
9366  bool fftReady = false;
9367  double output = 0.0;
9368 
9369  // --- normal processing
9370  output = vocoder.processAudioSample(input, fftReady);
9371 
9372  // --- if FFT is here, GO!
9373  if (fftReady)
9374  {
9375  // --- get the FFT data
9376  fftw_complex* fftData = vocoder.getFFTData();
9377 
9378  if (parameters.enablePeakPhaseLocking)
9379  {
9380  // --- get the magnitudes for searching
9381  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9382  {
9383  binData[i].reset();
9384  peakBins[i] = -1;
9385 
9386  // --- store mag and phase
9387  binData[i].magnitude = getMagnitude(fftData[i][0], fftData[i][1]);
9388  binData[i].phi = getPhase(fftData[i][0], fftData[i][1]);
9389  }
9390 
9391  findPeaksAndRegionsOfInfluence();
9392 
9393  // --- each bin data should now know its local boss-peak
9394  //
9395  // --- now propagate phases accordingly
9396  //
9397  // FIRST: set PSI angles of bosses
9398  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9399  {
9400  double mag_k = binData[i].magnitude;
9401  double phi_k = binData[i].phi;
9402 
9403  // --- horizontal phase propagation
9404  //
9405  // --- omega_k = bin frequency(k)
9406  double omega_k = kTwoPi*i / PSM_FFT_LEN;
9407 
9408  // --- phase deviation is actual - expected phase
9409  // = phi_k -(phi(last frame) + wk*ha
9410  double phaseDev = phi_k - phi[i] - omega_k*ha;
9411 
9412  // --- unwrapped phase increment
9413  double deltaPhi = omega_k*ha + principalArg(phaseDev);
9414 
9415  // --- save for next frame
9416  phi[i] = phi_k;
9417 
9418  // --- if peak, assume it could have hopped from a different bin
9419  if (binData[i].isPeak)
9420  {
9421  // --- calculate new phase based on stretch factor; save phase for next time
9422  if(binData[i].previousPeakBin < 0)
9423  psi[i] = principalArg(psi[i] + deltaPhi * alphaStretchRatio);
9424  else
9425  psi[i] = principalArg(psi[binDataPrevious[i].previousPeakBin] + deltaPhi * alphaStretchRatio);
9426  }
9427 
9428  // --- save peak PSI (new angle)
9429  binData[i].psi = psi[i];
9430 
9431  // --- for IFFT
9432  binData[i].updatedPhase = binData[i].psi;
9433  }
9434 
9435  // --- now set non-peaks
9436  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9437  {
9438  if (!binData[i].isPeak)
9439  {
9440  int myPeakBin = binData[i].localPeakBin;
9441 
9442  double PSI_kp = binData[myPeakBin].psi;
9443  double phi_kp = binData[myPeakBin].phi;
9444 
9445  // --- save for next frame
9446  // phi[i] = binData[myPeakBin].phi;
9447 
9448  // --- calculate new phase, locked to boss peak
9449  psi[i] = principalArg(PSI_kp - phi_kp - binData[i].phi);
9450  binData[i].updatedPhase = psi[i];// principalArg(PSI_kp - phi_kp - binData[i].phi);
9451  }
9452  }
9453 
9454  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9455  {
9456  double mag_k = binData[i].magnitude;
9457 
9458  // --- convert back
9459  fftData[i][0] = mag_k*cos(binData[i].updatedPhase);
9460  fftData[i][1] = mag_k*sin(binData[i].updatedPhase);
9461 
9462  // --- save for next frame
9463  binDataPrevious[i] = binData[i];
9464  peakBinsPrevious[i] = peakBins[i];
9465 
9466  }
9467  }// end if peak locking
9468 
9469  else // ---> old school
9470  {
9471  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9472  {
9473  double mag_k = getMagnitude(fftData[i][0], fftData[i][1]);
9474  double phi_k = getPhase(fftData[i][0], fftData[i][1]);
9475 
9476  // --- horizontal phase propagation
9477  //
9478  // --- omega_k = bin frequency(k)
9479  double omega_k = kTwoPi*i / PSM_FFT_LEN;
9480 
9481  // --- phase deviation is actual - expected phase
9482  // = phi_k -(phi(last frame) + wk*ha
9483  double phaseDev = phi_k - phi[i] - omega_k*ha;
9484 
9485  // --- unwrapped phase increment
9486  double deltaPhi = omega_k*ha + principalArg(phaseDev);
9487 
9488  // --- save for next frame
9489  phi[i] = phi_k;
9490 
9491  // --- calculate new phase based on stretch factor; save phase for next time
9492  psi[i] = principalArg(psi[i] + deltaPhi * alphaStretchRatio);
9493 
9494  // --- convert back
9495  fftData[i][0] = mag_k*cos(psi[i]);
9496  fftData[i][1] = mag_k*sin(psi[i]);
9497  }
9498  }
9499 
9500 
9501  // --- manually so the IFFT (OPTIONAL)
9502  vocoder.doInverseFFT();
9503 
9504  // --- can get the iFFT buffers
9505  fftw_complex* inv_fftData = vocoder.getIFFTData();
9506 
9507  // --- make copy (can speed this up)
9508  double ifft[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { 0.0 };
9509  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9510  ifft[i] = inv_fftData[i][0];
9511 
9512  // --- resample the audio as if it were stretched
9513  resample(&ifft[0], outputBuff, PSM_FFT_LEN, outputBufferLength, interpolation::kLinear, windowCorrection, windowBuff);
9514 
9515  // --- overlap-add the interpolated buffer to complete the operation
9516  vocoder.doOverlapAdd(&outputBuff[0], outputBufferLength);
9517  }
9518 
9519  return output;
9520  }
9521 
9526  PSMVocoderParameters getParameters()
9527  {
9528  return parameters;
9529  }
9530 
9535  void setParameters(const PSMVocoderParameters& params)
9536  {
9537  if (params.pitchShiftSemitones != parameters.pitchShiftSemitones)
9538  {
9539  setPitchShift(params.pitchShiftSemitones);
9540  }
9541 
9542  // --- save
9543  parameters = params;
9544  }
9545 
9546 protected:
9547  PSMVocoderParameters parameters;
9548  PhaseVocoder vocoder;
9549  double alphaStretchRatio = 1.0;
9550 
9551  // --- FFT is 4096 with 75% overlap
9552  const double hs = PSM_FFT_LEN / 4;
9553  double ha = PSM_FFT_LEN / 4;
9554  double phi[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { 0.0 };
9555  double psi[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { 0.0 };
9556 
9557  // --- for peak-locking
9558  BinData binData[PSM_FFT_LEN];
9559  BinData binDataPrevious[PSM_FFT_LEN];
9560 
9561  int peakBins[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { -1 };
9562  int peakBinsPrevious[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { -1 };
9563 
9564  double* windowBuff = nullptr;
9565  double* outputBuff = nullptr;
9566  double windowCorrection = 0.0;
9567  unsigned int outputBufferLength = 0;
9568 };
9569 
9570 // --- sample rate conversion
9571 //
9572 // --- supported conversion ratios - you can EASILY add more to this
9586 enum class rateConversionRatio { k2x, k4x };
9587 const unsigned int maxSamplingRatio = 4;
9588 
9598 inline unsigned int countForRatio(rateConversionRatio ratio)
9599 {
9600  if (ratio == rateConversionRatio::k2x)
9601  return 2;
9602  else if (ratio == rateConversionRatio::k4x || ratio == rateConversionRatio::k4x)
9603  return 4;
9604 
9605  return 0;
9606 }
9607 
9608 // --- get table pointer for built-in anti-aliasing LPFs
9620 inline double* getFilterIRTable(unsigned int FIRLength, rateConversionRatio ratio, unsigned int sampleRate)
9621 {
9622  // --- we only have built in filters for 44.1 and 48 kHz
9623  if (sampleRate != 44100 && sampleRate != 48000) return nullptr;
9624 
9625  // --- choose 2xtable
9626  if (ratio == rateConversionRatio::k2x)
9627  {
9628  if (sampleRate == 44100)
9629  {
9630  if (FIRLength == 128)
9631  return &LPF128_882[0];
9632  else if (FIRLength == 256)
9633  return &LPF256_882[0];
9634  else if (FIRLength == 512)
9635  return &LPF512_882[0];
9636  else if (FIRLength == 1024)
9637  return &LPF1024_882[0];
9638  }
9639  if (sampleRate == 48000)
9640  {
9641  if (FIRLength == 128)
9642  return &LPF128_96[0];
9643  else if (FIRLength == 256)
9644  return &LPF256_96[0];
9645  else if (FIRLength == 512)
9646  return &LPF512_96[0];
9647  else if (FIRLength == 1024)
9648  return &LPF1024_96[0];
9649  }
9650  }
9651 
9652  // --- choose 4xtable
9653  if (ratio == rateConversionRatio::k4x)
9654  {
9655  if (sampleRate == 44100)
9656  {
9657  if (FIRLength == 128)
9658  return &LPF128_1764[0];
9659  else if (FIRLength == 256)
9660  return &LPF256_1764[0];
9661  else if (FIRLength == 512)
9662  return &LPF512_1764[0];
9663  else if (FIRLength == 1024)
9664  return &LPF1024_1764[0];
9665  }
9666  if (sampleRate == 48000)
9667  {
9668  if (FIRLength == 128)
9669  return &LPF128_192[0];
9670  else if (FIRLength == 256)
9671  return &LPF256_192[0];
9672  else if (FIRLength == 512)
9673  return &LPF512_192[0];
9674  else if (FIRLength == 1024)
9675  return &LPF1024_192[0];
9676  }
9677  }
9678  return nullptr;
9679 }
9680 
9681 // --- get table pointer for built-in anti-aliasing LPFs
9693 inline double** decomposeFilter(double* filterIR, unsigned int FIRLength, unsigned int ratio)
9694 {
9695  unsigned int subBandLength = FIRLength / ratio;
9696  double ** polyFilterSet = new double*[ratio];
9697  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < ratio; i++)
9698  {
9699  double* polyFilter = new double[subBandLength];
9700  polyFilterSet[i] = polyFilter;
9701  }
9702 
9703  int m = 0;
9704  for (int i = 0; i < subBandLength; i++)
9705  {
9706  for (int j = ratio - 1; j >= 0; j--)
9707  {
9708  double* polyFilter = polyFilterSet[j];
9709  polyFilter[i] = filterIR[m++];
9710  }
9711  }
9712 
9713  return polyFilterSet;
9714 }
9715 
9727 struct InterpolatorOutput
9728 {
9729  InterpolatorOutput() {}
9730  double audioData[maxSamplingRatio] = { 0.0 };
9731  unsigned int count = maxSamplingRatio;
9732 };
9733 
9734 
9752 class Interpolator
9753 {
9754 public:
9755  Interpolator() { } /* C-TOR */
9756  ~Interpolator() { } /* D-TOR */
9757 
9765  inline void initialize(unsigned int _FIRLength, rateConversionRatio _ratio, unsigned int _sampleRate, bool _polyphase = true)
9766  {
9767  polyphase = _polyphase;
9768  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
9769  FIRLength = _FIRLength;
9770  ratio = _ratio;
9771  unsigned int count = countForRatio(ratio);
9772  unsigned int subBandLength = FIRLength / count;
9773 
9774  // --- straight SRC, no polyphase
9775  convolver.initialize(FIRLength);
9776 
9777  // --- set filterIR from built-in set - user can always override this!
9778  double* filterTable = getFilterIRTable(FIRLength, ratio, sampleRate);
9779  if (!filterTable) return;
9780  convolver.setFilterIR(filterTable);
9781 
9782  if (!polyphase) return;
9783 
9784  // --- decompose filter
9785  double** polyPhaseFilters = decomposeFilter(filterTable, FIRLength, count);
9786  if (!polyPhaseFilters)
9787  {
9788  polyphase = false;
9789  return;
9790  }
9791 
9792  // --- set the individual polyphase filter IRs on the convolvers
9793  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
9794  {
9795  polyPhaseConvolvers[i].initialize(subBandLength);
9796  polyPhaseConvolvers[i].setFilterIR(polyPhaseFilters[i]);
9797  delete[] polyPhaseFilters[i];
9798  }
9799 
9800  delete[] polyPhaseFilters;
9801  }
9802 
9804  inline InterpolatorOutput interpolateAudio(double xn)
9805  {
9806  unsigned int count = countForRatio(ratio);
9807 
9808  // --- setup output
9809  InterpolatorOutput output;
9810  output.count = count;
9811 
9812  // --- interpolators need the amp correction
9813  double ampCorrection = double(count);
9814 
9815  // --- polyphase uses "backwards" indexing for interpolator; see book
9816  int m = count-1;
9817  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
9818  {
9819  if (!polyphase)
9820  output.audioData[i] = i == 0 ? ampCorrection*convolver.processAudioSample(xn) : ampCorrection*convolver.processAudioSample(0.0);
9821  else
9822  output.audioData[i] = ampCorrection*polyPhaseConvolvers[m--].processAudioSample(xn);
9823  }
9824  return output;
9825  }
9826 
9827 protected:
9828  // --- for straight, non-polyphase
9829  FastConvolver convolver;
9830 
9831  // --- we save these for future expansion, currently only sparsely used
9832  unsigned int sampleRate = 44100;
9833  unsigned int FIRLength = 256;
9834  rateConversionRatio ratio = rateConversionRatio::k2x;
9835 
9836  // --- polyphase: 4x is max right now
9837  bool polyphase = true;
9838  FastConvolver polyPhaseConvolvers[maxSamplingRatio];
9839 };
9840 
9852 struct DecimatorInput
9853 {
9854  DecimatorInput() {}
9855  double audioData[maxSamplingRatio] = { 0.0 };
9856  unsigned int count = maxSamplingRatio;
9857 };
9858 
9877 class Decimator
9878 {
9879 public:
9880  Decimator() { } /* C-TOR */
9881  ~Decimator() { } /* D-TOR */
9882 
9890  inline void initialize(unsigned int _FIRLength, rateConversionRatio _ratio, unsigned int _sampleRate, bool _polyphase = true)
9891  {
9892  polyphase = _polyphase;
9893  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
9894  FIRLength = _FIRLength;
9895  ratio = _ratio;
9896  unsigned int count = countForRatio(ratio);
9897  unsigned int subBandLength = FIRLength / count;
9898 
9899  // --- straight SRC, no polyphase
9900  convolver.initialize(FIRLength);
9901 
9902  // --- set filterIR from built-in set - user can always override this!
9903  double* filterTable = getFilterIRTable(FIRLength, ratio, sampleRate);
9904  if (!filterTable) return;
9905  convolver.setFilterIR(filterTable);
9906 
9907  if (!polyphase) return;
9908 
9909  // --- decompose filter
9910  double** polyPhaseFilters = decomposeFilter(filterTable, FIRLength, count);
9911  if (!polyPhaseFilters)
9912  {
9913  polyphase = false;
9914  return;
9915  }
9916 
9917  // --- set the individual polyphase filter IRs on the convolvers
9918  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
9919  {
9920  polyPhaseConvolvers[i].initialize(subBandLength);
9921  polyPhaseConvolvers[i].setFilterIR(polyPhaseFilters[i]);
9922  delete[] polyPhaseFilters[i];
9923  }
9924 
9925  delete[] polyPhaseFilters;
9926  }
9927 
9929  inline double decimateAudio(DecimatorInput data)
9930  {
9931  unsigned int count = countForRatio(ratio);
9932 
9933  // --- setup output
9934  double output = 0.0;
9935 
9936  // --- polyphase uses "forwards" indexing for decimator; see book
9937  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
9938  {
9939  if (!polyphase) // overwrites output; only the last output is saved
9940  output = convolver.processAudioSample(data.audioData[i]);
9941  else
9942  output += polyPhaseConvolvers[i].processAudioSample(data.audioData[i]);
9943  }
9944  return output;
9945  }
9946 
9947 protected:
9948  // --- for straight, non-polyphase
9949  FastConvolver convolver;
9950 
9951  // --- we save these for future expansion, currently only sparsely used
9952  unsigned int sampleRate = 44100;
9953  unsigned int FIRLength = 256;
9954  rateConversionRatio ratio = rateConversionRatio::k2x;
9955 
9956  // --- polyphase: 4x is max right now
9957  bool polyphase = true;
9958  FastConvolver polyPhaseConvolvers[maxSamplingRatio];
9959 };
9960 
9961 #endif
